DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Sample Normal Control Preservation Method Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent the kind of preservation method used for the normal control specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Sample Normal Control Preservation Technique
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm._The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another._The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.definition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.:The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDDP SSF form per request by K.Wildermuth. mc 2/8/2016

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Means of preservation of cells, tissues, or organs by freezing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A quantity having a value less than zero.::1: A natural number greater than seventy-nine and less than eighty-one and the quantity that it denotes.::2: A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 0 degrees and the boiling point is 100 degrees at standard atmospheric pressure. The current official definition of the Celsius sets 0.01 C to be at the triple point of water and a degree to be 1/273.16 of the difference in temperature between the triple point of water and absolute zero. One degree Celsius represents the same temperature difference as one Kelvin.

Concepts.definition: A quantity having a value less than zero.
A natural number greater than seventy-nine and less than eighty-one and the quantity that it denotes.

A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 0 degrees and the boiling point is 100 degrees at standard atmospheric pressure. The current official definition of the Celsius sets 0.01 C to be at the triple point of water and a degree to be 1/273.16 of the difference in temperature between the triple point of water and absolute zero. One degree Celsius represents the same temperature difference as one Kelvin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A substance in the fluid state of matter having no fixed shape but a fixed volume.: Nitrogen

Concepts.definition: A substance in the fluid state of matter having no fixed shape but a fixed volume.
An element with atomic symbol N, atomic number 7, and atomic weight 14.01.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.: Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.

Concepts.definition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

DataElement.origin: CTSP/CDDP: Clinical Trial Sequencing and Cancer Driver Discovery Projects
